# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Data

wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines")

```julia
function wrap_string(str, text_width::Int = 10)
    lines = split(str, " ")
    result = ""

    for i in eachindex(lines)
        if i > 1 && length(result) + length(lines[i]) >= text_width
            result *= "\n"
        end
        result *= lines[i] * ' '
    end

    return strip(result)
end
```

This function splits the input string into words, and for each word, it checks if appending it to the current result would exceed the specified `text_width`. If so, a new line is added to the result. The function then strips any leading whitespace from the result.
